text: we have just stayed here in a two bed apartment for a week and are now planning a return visit. Jan,Adrain and Laura were very friendly and helpful nothing was too much trouble for them. The apartment was spacious,clean and well equipped with views out over the beach and sea. They are right next to the beach,cafe's and bars. There is also a lovely pool area which is perfect for everyone. we would highly recommend these apartments and we are looking forward to staying there again very soon.

Wonderful hotel location, staff, clean rooms, roof top bar and pool with great views over Funchal all made for a great stay We stayed in July the weather was wonderful our room was on the top floor with a balcony facing the park no noise for us we closed the balcony doors and put on the air con great nights sleep the whole two weeks.

We arrived with a young child (14 months) and had a great 5 night stay. The place is so clean and the service from the staff is fantastic.The all inclusive buffet option was great for the kids however it wouldn‚Äôt be restaurant quality but it‚Äôs definitely eatable.Great atmosphere about the hotel so would definitely return.

For giving a grade I give it an 8.Cleaning needs to be improved, hair all over the house. The house itself is very comfortable.We stayed for two days, we must bear in mind that they do not change towels or make beds.

Had a brilliant holiday. Extremely large, comfortable room kept spotless by a hardworking cleaner. Food good and plentiful (not very hot though at times). Lots of space and loungers at the poolside. Amazing rooftop terrace bar, on the 10th floor so view was spectacular. Staff friendly and helpful.

Cant fault the hotel of staff, all as expected, rooms were very spacious and cleaned daily, mini bar stocked every day only if you book direct with hotel, would have thought this was for all guests as 5* hotel. Food was good, the Brazilian restaurant tarbena was excellent, pools were a tad cold but once in it was fine.

Great resort, very close to the beach. We have stayed here many times and keep coming back for a reason.  Very quiet, spacious rooms.  The only thing that needs to be improved is the spa area. Without fail, nothing seems to work properly when we have been there.  Jacuzzi not very warm, jets are not working, dry sauna was out for half our stay. The towel situation needs to be resolved. They only give you one towel per person for the stay. These don't even fully cover a lounge chair and they will not give you another. On checkout, you had better make sure you brought your towels back to the spa to get your towel cards back or you will be charged. Not sure why the towels get treated like they are made out of gold.  We travel around the world and have never had a nice resort do similar. Other than that, everything was great and we will be back.

I currently reside at Jupiter Albufeira Hotel - Family & Fun and am extremely disappointed. The hotel is overcrowded, crowded everywhere, making the stay stressful instead of pleasant.Even with the ‚ÄúPlus‚Äù formula, which is very expensive, not all drinks are included and some are still extra, which is really abusive.The common areas are in an unacceptable state: extremely dirty and poorly maintained. The staff is unpleasant and the organization is catastrophic: we had booked a restaurant the day before, but the reservation was not even recorded, and we were simply told the same day that there was no reservation. As for the rooms, they are not made when we leave around 11am, and you have to call around 5pm to claim the cleaning, which is totally unacceptable for a so-called 5-star hotel.In short, I am in the middle of my stay and I already regret my choice: exorbitant price, questionable cleanliness, non-existent organization, unkind staff and services very far from promises. This hotel has 5 stars, but it definitely does not deserve them.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Oeiras By IHG
text: Very good hotel on the outskirts of Lisbon. It has supermarkets and a shopping center next door. Cozy, modern and very clean rooms. Correct breakfast. Very good machine coffee. Free parking. I don't know if there will be public transportation nearby, not the metro. Better to move by car.

This Hotel is situation about 15 minutes from the airport by cab, a 15 Euro ride and is located on the edge of the old Red Light district. Its about a 15 minute walk from here to the main harbour area and 20 minute walk to the bus station for all of the main tour busses. In our view quite central. You do have to walk through the China District to get into downtown but we were happy to do that. Staff are wonderful, helpful, happy to assist in any way possible. The rooms look out on either the avenue or the small piazza as the hotel is on a corner. we had a third floor room, quite small but quiet, away from the lift and not at all noisy. The view of the Avenue was really nothing to look at but this was a walking weekend to see the city and we found the room and hotel location to be fine. The hotel provides air conditioned rooms with coffee making facilities, lovely showers and super bedding and beds so we were very comfortable. We booked through Secret Escapes and were happy with the price which included breakfast and was about 120 pounds per night for the room and breakfast. Included is free wi fi and a smart phone with apps to get you around the city and 30 minutes free calling time on it. A really useful bit of equipment with google maps etc etc. so in my view a perfect get away hotel and we will definitely be back to stay. One other tip if you are staying longer than 3/4 days I think it would be worth paying for a larger room and give a bit more space as there is not a lot of hanging area in the smaller rooms. we loved it.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: This is a charming hotel very well located. I enjoyed very much my stay over there. The staff is very helpful and efficient. The rooms have a lot of charm in their decoration. The only thing I would like to have is a greater internet speed.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: The hotel is spotless and the staff are very friendly and very well mannered, nothing is too much trouble (late ironing request dealt with effortlessly).Great design with prompt room service. Spotlessly clean. You need not lift a finger should you so desire!The restaurant was fantastic, and well worth a try, which really is saying something given the very high standards of cuisine in Lisbon generally.Kiosks, shopping, bars, metro - all directly outside the hotel. You can't go wrong here. Thoroughly recommended.Ps - don't leave without visiting time out food hall - it's a game changer!Thanks to all the staff there who made my wife's birthday celebrations truly memorable!D&T

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: We stay at 5 star hotels often, and the Valverde Hotel is no 5 star hotel.  We travel often, and I always try to write reviews about our best and worst experiences to help others.  This hotel is in my worst column.  Look at my other reviews, and you can see I almost never give one star.These are some of the reasons this hotel is closer to a 3 or 4 star hotel:1.	The ‚Äúking bed‚Äù is two twin lumpy mattresses pushed together. Our nights were horrible, because the mattresses and pillows were so uncomfortable.2.	No door / privacy for the toilet, which means only one person at a time can use the entire bathroom.3.	No fan for the toilet.  So, you better hope you don‚Äôt get sick during your stay.4.	One tiny sink with limited counter space.5.	No gym / fitness center:  We‚Äôve never stayed in a 5 star hotel without a fitness center; so, it didn‚Äôt seem important to check that they had a gym. What they do have is a tiny wading pool.6.	Tiny pool:  The pool is closer to a wading pond located right outside the restaurant.  It isn‚Äôt large enough for an adult to swim for fitness.  The pictures are deceptive.7.	One tiny elevator.  If it breaks during your stay, yikes.8.	Lack of toilet paper:  We almost ran out twice. We ran out of facial tissue once.9.	Lack of towels:  We were only given 2.  Most 5 stars will at least give you an addition 2 in case you need them.10.	Super expensive for the size and lack of typical amenities.I could go on listing other things, but I will spare you more details.  Some of these items alone would knock this off a 5 star experience; in combination, it just made us feel more and more robbed.We booked this hotel and paid a fortune to stay here, because it was listed as a 5 star hotel and the reviews were so good.  There a ton of other 5 star hotels nearby.  When we return to Lisbon, we will definitely be booking at a name brand hotel.

Our party of 5 were really looking forward to this based on earlier reviews . Although fabric of building and interior decor of high standard , length of time to serve food was deplorable , attitude of staff was couldn't care less . There was no sign of any management presence. Food itself was only just passable once it arrived .

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: We had a flight delay so missed the last train to Pinhao, only getting as far as Regua and taking an expensive taxi ride to the quinta.  The hotel had been concerned for us, were very welcoming at such a late hour, and had been communicating with another vendor we had reservations with during the week.  The room was beautiful and comfortable with wonderful views to wake up to, the grounds are stunning!  What a wonderful way to start a trip.The next day we had a nice tour of the wine making process and had tastings.  The wine was good, another couple from Neatherlands made for delightful company and the hotel allowed us a late checkout and drove us to the train station in order for us to continue our trip.Thank you for starting our trip off on the right foot after it seemed like it was going to go bad.

This hotel is so central to all amenities in Funchal, spotlessly clean, the beds were very comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful .Buffet breakfast which is plain, but good.This was our second stay here. I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: Beautiful, hospitable, great atmosphere located in the city center.  I even had cherries üçí in my room, and at the beautiful designed bar they had a great Fado singer, young and charming. It is unfortunate that I stay only one night in Lisbon.

Beautiful hotel. Close to sites at Behlem.  Spa is amazing.  Breakfast is superb.  The egg custards at the hotel breakfast are comparable to anywhere else in Lisbon and included when you get the breakfast.

Last day of a three day stay. What a lovely place. Staff very friendly, great pool area, studio apartment excellant, clean and comfortable. Bar open from 5pm, great value. Great location. WIFI good. Just short stroll down hill to beach ( minute or so). Mini market, restaurant and a couple of bars just outside of building. Easy access to bus stops etc. More than happy to return.

I enjoyed my stay here. The apartment was nice.  A lot of stairs to walk up with bags though.  The bed was a little uncomfortable.  It was well located.  The staff is very attentive and check in is easy although it is a little late

Another wonderful stay in a Porto Bay hotel.  Due to the hot weather the hotel provided a haven from the city break activities we would normally undertake.  We ventured out each morning (chose coffee etc in establshment recommended by hotel) followed by city break tourist hotpots, followed by afternoon sun lounging on our spacious balcony.  Perfect combination of citybreak and sun vacation.  Staff at hotel were most welcoming and helpful, particularly in light on ongoing taxi strike.  Also lovely cake, champagne and message delivered from hotel staff to mark my birthday.  Spent a lovely day on rooftop bar, use of jacuzzi and personal service from staff member, including lunch, could not fault his service.  We checked out price to return again before we left, such was our exprience.  Will definitely return soon.  Dinner in restaurant was wonderful experience.  All in all wonderful expierence.

Arrived v early ob first flight out so room not available which was no issue as the check in staff let us use a rest room to freshen up then stored our bags in left luggage.We ventured around the city and upon return found our bags already up in room  605.An excellent hotel,plenty of fresh breakfast if you looked around the small but very well organised buffet.Hot food,cold food,all manner of cakes and jam.Coffee was to die for with fresh orange also.Many nice places to eat outside the hotel too if you like to meet with the locals.A wonderful few days and will definitely be back.Transport fro Lisbon airport is best achieved by metro ,buy an all day ticket 7‚Ç¨ and its quick ,safe and clean.Buy a yellow bus pass allowing you to use yellow hop on/off bus routes,the hills tram circular route,tramcars,funicular railways x4,the tower lift and the ferry boat all on one ticket.All in all a fabulous place ,bang on the tube and handy for the old and new parts of Lisbon.Try the oceanarium its stunning and reachable via the yellow bus hop on/off blue route.Friendly trustworthy and very welcoming people.Thanks again.Mr & Mrs C

Staying in studio. After staying here years ago the room doesn't look any different.  Can only assume not all rooms have been done.  The public areas are absolutely lovely but not so keen on the room. No bedside cabinets, hardly any storage for clothes and no TV or air con remote in room. Do we have to pay for them? Good job not here to watch tv.

The hotel is on a quiet leafy street which is within walking distance of the point from where the Hop on , hop off buses operateThis offered us an excellent way of exploring the city of LisbonWhilst our room was fairly compact - it was very well designed and we had a very comfortable stayBreakfasts were excellent- with a wide selection of foodWe dined in a several occasions and enjoyed the foodThe concierge was very helpful and gave us lots of useful tips and suggestions for exploring LisbonOverall a very enjoyable stay

A lovely clean hotel with great sized and well equipped rooms. The meals were superb and the staff went overboard to be helpful. The pool area had plenty of available sun beds and parasols, and The gym and jacuzzi were great too. Wi fi was available in our room. The beach nearby was great, but down a steepish hill.

My hubby is a platinum member so he wanted to stay here.  We were treated well and enjoyed their lounge  We had to take a cab to the main attractions and also used the metro around the city plus walked a lot.  We tried to walk out by the Marriott but not great areas to walk and lots of trash everywhere.  The hotel is near all the hospitals and a college.  Nice to have the extra ammenities but I would suggest a closer in place if touring Lisbon.

Wonderful experience. Phenomenal staff, especially Sophia. Really wonderful lady with truly pleasant and sincere attitude. Excellent breakfast and good size rooms with comfortable beds. Clean and comfortable boutique hotel. Can't wait to come back!

The location of this resort is great!! The apartment is small but nicely furnished and clean. My teen daughter and I loved our stay at this hotel. The elevator is very convenient as we were on the top floor. If you also happen to stay on the top floor, just keep in mind that the windows leak a bit when it rains.  I really liked the small kitchen, everything we needed was there (coffee maker, fridge, kettle, etc.) Outside can get a bit noisy during the day and at night. It is a busy area so if you're looking for a quiet place to stay - this one is not for you. Loved the cleaning lady, she was wonderful and very helpful.  Front desk lady was a bit unfriendly at times.  It seemed like she didn't really like us.  Despite this, I feel like this was a great choice for our first time to Lisbon and I highly recommend it!

hotel_name: Hotel Covilha Dona Maria Affiliated by Meli√°
date: S√≥nia Melo Diaswrote a review Jul 2015
text: Have you ever felt that you have made the wrong choice when picking a hotel? We know exactly the feeling‚Ä¶This one was most definitely one of the worst ones and people who classified this hotel as a 4 star hotel should have their heads checked‚Ä¶ By our standards it¬¥s hardly a 3 star hotel‚Ä¶The only thing good about it it¬¥s the location, anything else is a nightmare and it didn¬¥t take us long to realize that.When we were checking in, the employee warned us that we had to come down for breakfast before 8 a.m., or else, we would have to face waiting in line for more than 20 minutes. That just didn¬¥t make any sense to us, but the next day we understood what he meant: half of the restaurant was closed, so there weren¬¥t enough tables for breakfast and guests had to wait for other guests to finish so they could come in and have their own breakfast. Even though there were empty tables, there were still people waiting to get in the restaurant. That is just awful service, isn¬¥t it?But it doesn¬¥t end here‚Ä¶Can you imagine a swimming pool with no loungers or any other equipment where you can relax by the pool? Neither can we, but there wasn¬¥t any. We had to sit on the floor!!! No, I¬¥m not done yet and the worst is yet to come‚Ä¶ The swimming pool smelled of urine, it was impossible to be in there. I was utterly disgusted.We couldn¬¥t sleep all night because of the noise in the hall outside the bedroom. Lots of families with children and obviously no education‚Ä¶Never again!

Beautiful location for a relaxed stay. Rent a car to enjoy all the nice places in this area... Restaurante Mona Lisa and Julio`s are excellent in Carvoeiro. If you are a Golf-beginner, there is a perfect Court to learn it for less....

Very quiet and clean hotel with very friendly staff. Stunning view and great facilities. Several pools, great spa and gym. Amazing breakfast. Cocktails should be elevated more for the price. This hotel has it all

A smart hotel with comfortable rooms. For the price I thought the room would have been cleaner(quite a lot of dust on ledges and tables) and the service at breakfast better.  Great shower but a bit awkward to hang your towels without getting them wet. The selection at breakfast was very good. Also the gym was very disappointing. I didn't use the spa but wish I had tried it. The pool and spa facilities looked better than the gym.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: We stayed at this stunning hotel and felt completely safe in every way. The staff are fantastic and work hard to make sure you are safe and happy. Although we had to return home early due to flights being affected by UK lockdown restrictions we enjoyed six out our original 11 days at Reids. Our room was lovely, having a view of the sea and Funchal. We didn‚Äôt manage to eat at William but all the other restaurants were great, with Villa Cipriani being a favourite. Breakfast by the pool was a delight and again the staff were great. If you want a beautiful hotel with great service and relaxing atmosphere then look no further than Reids. This was our first visit but won‚Äôt be our last.

An amazing experience, just what we needed. I would highly recommend this hotel, for the hospitality and professionalism, the staff were really helpful and friendly. The activities were enjoyable and engaging, we had loads of fun!!

We would recommend the hotel, although it was showing a little sign of wear and tear, overall it is fine, very clean and the staff were helpful and accommodating. The setting is stunning and the location is excellent. The bottom line is we would stay at the hotel again!

I stayed here with my mum and dad for four nights as a winter break. The flat was very spacious and nicely furnished. We loved the fresh bread delivered in time for breakfast every day. The location is perfect for all the sights. Highly recommended!

Amazing Hotel, relaxed energy throughout the place, professional workers. Just a joy to be in this place. Only down side is they charge parking at ‚Ç¨7 daily but you have a choice parking the car outside the hotel for free where there is no yellow line.The outside pool is great and wonderful when warm and sunny.

We always go back to Quinta do Fur√£o as often as we can. The kids love it, it is a perfect place not only for family but for couples, single visitors or digital nomads. The scenery is breathtaking, the hotel has been recently refurbished and they added extra rooms and an incredible and most Instagramable infinity pool in the middle of the vineyards with views to the see and the cliffs. The excellent brunch gets you pumped to go walking levadas and the restaurant has courses that waters your mouth together with a fantastic view. Definitely one of my favourite places to stay in for a few days!
Sometimes you make mistakes, this was one of them. Location was ok√© but al the rest was not even 1 star worth.

Lovely hotel right on the beach front side sea view room not bad but sea front rooms obviously so much betterBreakfast well worth it but rather busy but don't worry they replenish food quickly.Hint grab your own coffee or tea jug otherwise use wait

We stayed at Vila Senhora da Rocha Feb to Apr 2016, using it as a home base for our vacation exploring Portugal.  The resort is beautiful.  Their chef Antonio was fantastic.   Highly recommend their restaurant by the pool.  We are already booked for to return for another 3 months in Feb 2017.

We had a fantastic experience at Gat Rossio. The room was spacious and clean. Staff were super attentive and super friendly. Room service cleaned our rooms whilst we were out. They have a gorgeous lounge area when we wanted a moments silence from the hustle and bustle of busy portugal.And a special thank you to our host, Deborah, who catered to our every need.Will definitely be staying here again.

So glad we booked a balcony room, to enjoy the view. A stunning location with excellent staff. A thoroughly enjoyable stay. Food available in the restaurant and bar. I'd advise a hire car as its a little out of the way, 30/40 mins ish up hill walk into town.

My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a week between 21st-28th June. We booked a Junior Suite with sea view, which is what we got.  The room was spotless with a great big bed, lush bathroom with a walk in shower, no bath.  The seating area had a couch, chairs & coffee table but no extra TV, which you sometimes get, which gives you and idea of the size of the room because although the room had a seating area it was only partioned off by a curtain, but essentially it was just one standard size room. The balcony was small and we didn't get the sun at all because it was covered ( room 530) and for some reason it only has one seat.  The coffee machine is easy to use to get hot water. When you arrive put the water in the back, switch on and leave on all the time which keeps the water hot ready for coffee or tea which is provided. Breakfast had plenty of choice but although busy it's easy to get around, however omelettes take time to cook so you may have a little wait and you have to ask for coffee and tea the staff don't ask you like most hotels. We didn't have any problem with the staff they always brought anything we asked for promptly.  My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the lobby bar were we got great service from the bar staff.  The bar had our special vodkas and gins that we like and the drinks were very professionally made.  The prices are equivalent to an up market hotel but we always got a plate of mixed nuts which we loved.  The bad points about this hotel have been noted a lot by previous guests.  The first being the sunbed problem, were you have to get up very early for the sun beds around the pool which have the padded mattresses, if you don't get one of them, from about 9am upwards you can put your towels on the grass verge and get a cheap plastic sunbed or a bean bag.  The issue is the people who put towels on the sun beds but don't come down to sunbathe until late morning and go away and come back.  The second issue is the prices at the pool bar, we found that one day it was one price, but for the same drinks the next day they were more expensive.  And the prices seem to be the same as the indoor bar which was obviously better quality, served to your table and also you are given snacks to go with them.  Not sure what's going on, my husband concluded the staff were being a bit sneaky but we only went twice so I'm not sure, although he did challenge the pool bar staff and they weren't able to produce a price list.  All in all we enjoyed our stay at this hotel very much, the bed was amazingly comfortable, the room was very quite and the location was great for the Marina.  We are definately going to stay at this hotel again in the future.

Just returned from a week at this hotel.  It is in a very peaceful location (not a slum area!).Everything is within easy walking distance (restaurants, shops, cablecar, marina).We chose the Albergaria Dias for a relaxing break, and that is what we got.  The hotel is clean and the staff very friendly, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, it was our fist visit to Madeira and we would definately stay here again.

hotel_name: Estalagem de Marv√É¬£o - Casa de Campo
text: We made our first visit to Marvao on the 8 January we were booked into the Estalagem de Marvao. Prior to our arrival the hotel sent us a very helpful email covering a range of useful items including exactly how to get to the hotel once you are inside the walls of the village.The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was very good. There is an excellent restaurant two minutes walk from the hotel. The fortified village is on the top of a very high hill and is worth exploring. The views from the castle are outstanding.We will be returning on a future visit.

Excellent hotel, good value with friendly staff. Fantastic views over the bay of Funchal.  It was my first time in Madeira and I will definitely stay at the Ocean Gardens again. The hotel is not central but there is a bus stop outside the hotel and also a twice daily complimentary shuttle bus into Funchal.

This is a massive TripAdvisor favourite - an award-winner in fact. Therefore we made sure to fit in a couple of nights there. However, we are left not entirely knowing what all the fuss was about. The service is entirely deserving of top marks - at the checkout and bar the staff could not be more friendly and helpful. The location is great too - very close to the old town and promenade and a world away from the isolated and drab area in which most of the big hotels reside.However, none of this changes the simple sad fact that the room is nowhere close to 4* (although ours had a great view). It was small, a little old-fashioned, with hard beds (twin when double had been requested), broken safe and air-con that can't be altered by occupants.So, to conclude - it's not a bland 3* rating. It's just that some things are great and others significantly less so!

The location is good; just across the river from Coimbra, so it was a short walk up the main street. The hotel rooms are in two side-by-side buildings filled with interior staircases and odd little spaces. Our room looked like (from the map on the door) it was one of the bigger ones, but it also has two Murphy beds beside the one double bed. The bathroom is small, and the sink is tiny with no stopper. And there‚Äôs really no place to put anything in the bathroom. I can‚Äôt imagine four people sharing that bathroom. Other people in our group complained about having small rooms, so there was clearly lots of variation. Everything was very clean and the staff were very nice. There is a small patio behind the basement-level breakfast room, but no one was using it during our stay.

We spent an enjoyable week at the Vila Gale Tavira. The room we had was cool in the daytime and was well fitted with a fridge, TV, bath and shower. There was always lots of hot water available instantly which is always a blessing in hot climates.The breakfast was excellent. All tastes were catered for, including English, a chef was available to cook your eggs and omelettes just how you desire. The drinks are on the expensive side but this is a hotel so par for the course. The bar meals were good value and available all day.The atmosphere around the pool was excellent, relaxed but not too quiet. The piped music did not intrude into the atmosphere. The staff were attentive and polite.The hotel is in a quite part of Tavira but only a few minutes√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢ walk from the man area for restaurants.All in all, we had an excellent holiday. We thoroughly enjoyed our time there and would be happy to return.For the price we paid for the holiday it was excellent value.

Good location. Varied and quality breakfast. Very friendly reception staff. We'll repeat. The truth is that the Eurostars chain never fails. We've been to Berlin, Seville... Eurostars a hit every time. You'll tell me. Quite a hit. Really.

This hotel is in a very scenic and attractive location with some limited local facilities partly dedicated to religious themes but is a distance from central Barga. There are some empty and run down old hotels in the vicinity along with a convent and church accommodation The hotel has been newly refurbished in an interesting style that gives the impression that a talented interior designer has been given a free hand. We stayed for 4 days in a party of 22. Our room was small, quiet, very comfortable and tasteful. We had an adequate breakfast in a small dining room, the hotel bar was not really up and running, Dinner (so-so standard) was served in a near by co-owned hotel which provided spectacular views from the dining area. Nearby is a fairly basic terrace bar again with panoramic views were we had  pre and after dinner drinks. All the staff in every establishment were super and very anxious to help. This hotel and its staff deserve future success.

Rooms: Very good room, clean, a bit old style, I'm guessing it need a restyle in 5-10 years time. No problem with sound issues.Common areas: Wide main lobby, very quiet, it seems not to be a children hotel. Sometimes this is organic with hotel environment and this is not the case, which is good for me.Pool: One pool for kids and another for adults. Good area and a good place to relax.Food: Breakfast is ok, Typical choices, nothing extraordinary. Tried a Salad in the bar, not so good.Location: Very good location, walking distance from Tavira center.

We are a family of 4 so are somewhat limited in finding quad or family hotel rooms in the city. We needed to stay one night in Lisbon before flying home. This hotel was just a couple of subway stops from the sete rios train station where we arrived from the Agarve and right across the street from a subway station that took us easily to the airport the next morning. There are many restaurants in the area, the hotel staff was friendly and efficient, and the room itself was clean and comfortable. We would definitely stay here again!

Centrally located and walking distance to museums, shopping, restaurants and sightseeing.Clean and modern furniture and comfortable bedding. However, rooms are somewhat compact or small...tight fit. Bathrooms are even more compact!  One person at a time!  Towel racks are located in the shower itself so you have to be very careful when turning on the water to the handheld shower head...it may be aimed at the towels!!!Electrical outlets are not conveniently located and could not be reached easily.  In our room, they were located just above the baseboards under the fixed night stands.  Required I get on my knees to try to plug in my electrical adapter and for my cellphone and iPad chargers.Buffet Breakfast is included with your stay.  Variety of foods and drinks (including sparking wine!!!).  However, the menu is the same every morning.No gym or swimming pool just outdoor garden and sitting area.

We were here for our honey moon and we stayed for 5 nights. We were offered complementary sparkling wine and chocolate dipped strawberries (excellent!). I liked everything about it: free wi-fi, very good selection of TV channels, the full mini bar (not cheap, but one would expect that), the service (everybody was nice, smiling and joking), the big room., the gym, spa and pool. And of course the view. While it is not in the center of Lisbon, we preferred the stunning view to the location. And it paid off for us, as we wanted to see the Oceanarium as well, the train station and airport were very close. We had one dinner at their restaurant. The food was exceptional, but I would have liked more choices. All in all, a wonderful experience, I recommend it.

What a wonderful find. We came into Tomar for an overnight stay and wished we could have stayed much longer. Wonderful location super staff,tremendous facilities...including pool...great rooms..clean and large...great price....can,t say enough about the place. Really enjoyed my stay' no negatives at all' probably under rated if anything.

The hotel is really well appointed and has a feeling of luxury.  It might not be everyone's taste, but it has everything and everything works well.  We really enjoyed our two night stay.  The sun deck of the dining room is great place when the sun shines and the rooms are bright and modern.  The drawbacks of the hotel are (i) the service in the restaurant is bad for a top hotel, (ii) the toilet and bathroom are integrated into the rooms and this provides very little privacy for the toilet (a frosted glass door only) which is not ideal and (iii) the location is on the edge of Lisbon.  This is fine for the airport (10 minutes) and the MEO Arena (5 minutes walk) but not good for downtown. Having said all this I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't need to be in the city center and I would go back if I had the opportunity

This is an extra special gem of a hotel. The thoughtful attention to every detail is matched by excellent service. Guests are greeted with a delicious welcome drink (we could hear the cocktail shaker as we arrived) and a lovely fruit and cheese platter brought to the room. The grounds are spacious for a small hotel, with multiple levels and spaces offering different vantage points of the spectacular ocean view. We enjoyed the fire pit for after dinner star gazing and plane spotting, and especially relished the outdoor dining area (never leaving that view!). Every item on the menu is top notch, including the made-to-order breakfasts from an √† la carte menu. Many of the ingredients come from the owners' farm, so it everything is deliciously fresh. We will miss the Pico wines. We also appreciated the artisanship of the furnishings, including the ceramic bowls and pendant light fixtures, and delicate rattan chairs. In summary, this hotel is perfection and the perfect place to relax and recharge after exploring this amazing island. We highly recommend and would definitely return if we venture back to the Azores.

It was already my second stay in the Altis Belem Hotel in Lisbon and it was again a great experience. Not only the Hotel itself also the whole crew and equipment is perfect. The room with big windows gives you a great view on the harbour and have a pleasant size.The spa is extraordinary and also her all the employees are very helpful and professional.If I have to come back to Lisbon I will choose it again!

This was a great hostel to stay at perfect location right in the city centre easy to get to places all within walking distance, loved the breakfast that was included with scrambled eggs and cereals offered. Nice large rooms and great security with the drawer lockers and padlocks provided, think would have been good for a pub crawl but as we were there in the week nights it wasn't that busy. Enjoyed the room had its own bathroom and there were plenty more available close by. Staff were very friendly and helpful when it came to asking questions about how to get around the city, would definitely recommend this hostel.

Great service. Welcoming staff. Clean. Two rooms plus small kitchen corner in the apartment we had - perfect with kids sleeping in one and the grownups could sit and chat in the other. Easy to eat in with short breakfast for the smaller kids.

Received an upgrade on arrival which always nice to receive. Staff freindly and location quite good. A little bit out of the real tourist area but close to metro and mini mercado. Maccas across the road if desperate. Kitchen was missing a few things but apart from that it was good. Iron and board available on request ad were other items. A bit dated but spacious. Room at back overlooked pool and had big opening bay windows which was good area to dry a bit of hand washing.

Just come back from a week away staying at the Hotel Bahia Palace. Overall if you have booked here you will enjoy it. It is very central to the island - but you will need transport as about 25km outside of Ponta Delgada.  Although there is a pleasant walk into Vila Franca which we did on our first day and can highly recommend. The hotel is dated, but I understand is to be refurbished shortly. This did not spoil the holiday at all. Rooms were big and clean with stunning views over the Atlantic, and hopefully when refurbished they will keep as much of the wood within the hotel as possible.Staff were lovely and friendly and could not be more helpful, providing recommendations and booking taxis when needed.The hotel itself offers a shuttle bus into Ponta Delgada daily, which needs to be booked. It would be good if they offered to other places as well, and maybe an evening option so that restaurants in Ponta could be easily tried on an evening too.  For daytrips we used Greenzone Azores Jeep Trips which I can also recommend.The hotel food reminded me of trips to France / Spain in the late 70s / early 80s. Buffet breakfast was invariably cold. And I think (although could be wrong) the scrambled eggs were made from powdered eggs - consequently tried them once. Hopefully when refurbished they will have a cooking station, with someone cooking fresh eggs / omelettes / pancakes to order like in other European countries. It will taste better and be warm.  And the bread needs to be baked fresh not bought in.But considering the price paid, and everything else this is a small consideration.One final comment to the hotel (and to all tourist places in the Azores) - if you want to attract the British and American markets you need to stop the smoking in public places - e.g. restaurant / bar terraces. We all want to enjoy the outside when the weather allows, but smoking at tables when there is food is horrid and I know talking to other British and Americans on our trips we all found it very unpleasant and could stop us returning to the islands.

We stayed at the Hotel Comfort Principe May 29th through June 1st.  Our first night in Lisbon was in a TINY hotel room, so we really appreciated the size of the Comfort Principe's room.  We even had a couch to relax on, as well as a balcony.  When we first arrived we were given a room on the second floor with a view of the roofs, so we asked to be moved.  They quickly showed us a room on the 6th floor (smoking room) to see if we liked it.  We loved it, and there was no odor of cigarettes at all.The room was clean and nicely decorated.  The bathroom was large and all tiled in marble. They were remodeling the check in area while we were there, but it did not interfere with our stay.  The breakfast room was large and the food adequate.The hotel is a short walk to the Metro station inside a large department store.  It was very convenient, there was a supermarket and food court right there.  I recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't mind using public transportation for a five minute ride to the downtown sections of Lisbon.

I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights during a business event. I had a room on the 4th floor with a great view to the river and the bridge. The room was very well equipped and comfortable with all you can expect for a 5 star hotel: minifridge (1 bottle of water for free), flat screen TV, AC, Wireless Internet, and the possibility to connect your IPod via Bluetooth to an audio system, however, I did not try it out. The window in the room can be opened only partially, but that‚Äôs not a big problem.The provided breakfast is great, as well as the view of the breakfast-area to the river.The hotel is located on a promenade that runs along the river, which makes it great for running.If you arrive in Lisbon via the airport, the hotel is located only 3 stops away at the station ‚ÄúOriente‚Äù. If you take a taxi, it should be relatively cheap to get there. But the hotel is relatively new, so make sure the driver knows how to get there.Location wise, it is a bit far from downtown, but it is located next to a shopping mall. A taxi to downtown shouldn‚Äôt cost more than 10 Euro however. With the metro, it will be less than 2 Euro, but it will take longer, and, depending on your final destination, you might have to change to another line at least once.Overall, it is a great stay if you plan to relax only and if you don‚Äôt mind the taxi drive to downtown. If you want to experience Lisbon at best, I would suggest you stay as close to downtown as possible.

The B&B was really nice experience. the rooms were a bit funny but lovely and clean. There is access to the kitchen which makes this very comfortable if you want to prepare some food. I wouldn't really count on breakfast, because it was made from the cheapest brand in Madeira. but the bread was lovely. I also think that lady that looks after the guests should be a bit more nicer, especially that she works in hospitality business, so you either like people or not.

We returned to the Quinta da Marinha after five years. Although we have stayed at the hotel many times before, it was an even nicer experience this time. The rooms  have been completely renovated in a very nice way, the ambience is nice and welcoming. We travel a lot and stay at many nice hotels and we keep on returning to this hotel. A big praise to the team at the hotel for the excellent service and for ensuring safety and comfort during these difficult COVID-19 times. We felt very secure all along and one should not hesitate at all to stay at this nice golf resort hotel with beautiful surroundings. It is close to the sea and to downtown Cascais and world famous Guincho beach.We look forward to return to the hotel.

Beautiful surroundings ! Everything is there.The owner recommended a super tasty, pleasant restaurant and then made a reservation for us.There was plenty of everything in the fridge for breakfast. Unfortunately, only for one morning and so no replenishment was made. We only had 1 small fleet of jam for 1 person.We sent a message to the owner to bring another one, but no response was received...Swimming pool is not heated.Otherwise a beautiful domain!
